Since the reported concentration of hBD-2 in normal oral epithelium is about 10 μmoles/g tissue [Sawaki et al.], well within the inhibitory concentrations reported in the in vitro experiments with the X4 phenotype, further induction of hBD-2 (or hBD-3) by mucosal exposure to virus may provide protection against X4-tropic and potentially also against R5-tropic viruses.
